programme.title: The Bourne Legacy
Das Bourne-Vermächtnis
programme.desc: The Bourne Legacy: Directed by Tony Gilroy. With Jeremy Renner, Scott Glenn, Stacy Keach, Edward Norton. An expansion of the universe from Robert Ludlum's novels, centered on a new hero whose stakes have been triggered by the events of the previous three films." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1194173/","name":"The Bourne Legacy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc4Njk3MDM1Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODgyOTMxOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An expansion of the universe from Robert Ludlum's novels, centered on a new hero whose stakes have been triggered by the events of the previous three films.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1194173/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"antoniotierno"},"dateCreated":"2012-09-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"A bit cliché but packed with great action","reviewBody":"First film without Matt Damon and the Jason Bourne character. The movie turned out well and this is thanks to co-writer and director Tony Gilroy (who worked on all three previous films in the series) and Jeremy Renner, perfectly cast in the lead. The results are not flawless but good enough to provide the sort of action and storytelling that Bourne fans expect. Jeremy Renner has earned his way to this high-profile part, doing a great job since his performance in The Hurt Locker. He has the required physicality to make his character — a highly-trained, genetically enhanced undercover agent — totally believable. Furthermore he's perfectly matched with leading lady Rachel Weisz, also credible as a research doctor becoming a pawn and bail at the same time. On balance and on the whole the movie works, though a bit to long. To sum up I was entertained and I'm more than grateful for that."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":293836,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2012-09-05","keywords":"wolf,drone,pill,assassin,riding a motorcycle up stairs","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1065461017","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDk2MjY1NDIzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDI4NjEyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDk2MjY1NDIzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDI4NjEyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"An expansion of the universe from Robert Ludlum's novels, centered on a new hero whose stakes have been triggered by the events of the previous three films."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0719637/","name":"Jeremy Renner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001838/","name":"Rachel Weisz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001570/","name":"Edward Norton"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0006904/","name":"Tony Gilroy"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0013175/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0006904/","name":"Tony Gilroy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0319659/","name":"Dan Gilroy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0524924/","name":"Robert Ludlum"}],"duration":"PT2H15M"}</script><metacontent="

An expansion of the universe from Robert Ludlum's novels, centered on a new hero whose stakes have been triggered by the events of the previous three films." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1194173/","name":"The Bourne Legacy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc4Njk3MDM1Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODgyOTMxOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An expansion of the universe from Robert Ludlum's novels, centered on a new hero whose stakes have been triggered by the events of the previous three films.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1194173/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"antoniotierno","dateCreated":"2012-09-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"A bit cliché but packed with great action","reviewBody":"First film without Matt Damon and the Jason Bourne character. The movie turned out well and this is thanks to co-writer and director Tony Gilroy (who worked on all three previous films in the series) and Jeremy Renner, perfectly cast in the lead. The results are not flawless but good enough to provide the sort of action and storytelling that Bourne fans expect. Jeremy Renner has earned his way to this high-profile part, doing a great job since his performance in The Hurt Locker. He has the required physicality to make his character — a highly-trained, genetically enhanced undercover agent — totally believable. Furthermore he's perfectly matched with leading lady Rachel Weisz, also credible as a research doctor becoming a pawn and bail at the same time. On balance and on the whole the movie works, though a bit to long. programme.title: Die Wilden Hühner
Die wilden Hühner
programme.desc: Die Wilden Hühner: Directed by Vivian Naefe. With Michelle von Treuberg, Lucie Hollmann, Paula Romy, Zsá Zsá Inci. Sprotte is about 12 years old and has a "gang" with her three friends Frieda, Melanie and Trude. Together the girls take Care of Sprottes grandmothers chickens. The new girl in School, Wilma, wishes to join the group, which Melanie is very unhappy about, and on top of all of that they have an on going revalisasion with a group of boys. Sprottes grandmother is planning on slaughtering the chickens! Will the Wild Chicks put Down their war with the boys? And Will they be able to save the chicken?" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0466195/","name":"Die Wilden Hühner","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjA4ZjM0ZDMtMDdmZi00NzJhLWE3YjItOGVlZTZjZjE0Y2M1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzA3Njg4MzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Sprotte is about 12 years old and has a "gang" with her three friends Frieda, Melanie and Trude. Together the girls take Care of Sprottes grandmothers chickens. The new girl in School, Wilma, wishes to join the group, which Melanie i","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0466195/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Xenzi"},"dateCreated":"2006-02-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nicely done","reviewBody":"I've never been much of a fan of Cornelia Funke's "Wilde Hühner" books, so I took my 7-year-old daughter to see this with some reluctance. I was agreeably surprised, though. The story works, the kids are great, and what I liked best was the realistic portrayal of their family backgrounds, not quite the common fare in kid's movies. Most of it was subtly done, like in some of Astrid Lindgren's stories. These kids' troubles are for real, and if there's evil in this film, it's the evil of thoughtless neglect on the part of the parents. Every kid (and adult) can identify with that. The dialog tended to be too heavy sometimes, but this is the only real fault I could find. Gripping and touching.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":715,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"genre":["Adventure","Family"],"datePublished":"2006-02-09","keywords":"friendship,teacher,friend,strong female,chicken","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1922105/","name":"Michelle von Treuberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2080273/","name":"Lucie Hollmann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1743114/","name":"Paula Romy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0618996/","name":"Vivian Naefe"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026739/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050457/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1751315/","name":"Cornelia Funke"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0438651/","name":"Güzin Kar"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0716966/","name":"Uschi Reich"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Yogi Bear
Yogi Bär
programme.desc: Yogi Bear: Directed by Eric Brevig. With Dan Aykroyd, Justin Timberlake, Anna Faris, Tom Cavanagh. A documentary filmmaker travels to Jellystone Park to shoot a project and soon crosses paths with Yogi Bear, his sidekick Boo-Boo and Ranger Smith." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1302067/","name":"Yogi Bear","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmI0ZmMwMDYtNTk4OC00NGNhLTk3NDUtNjFmZTI5NTUzYTFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTUyMzE4Mzg@._V1_.jpg","description":"A documentary filmmaker travels to Jellystone Park to shoot a project and soon crosses paths with Yogi Bear, his sidekick Boo-Boo and Ranger Smith.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1302067/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"JustAnEpicPerson"},"dateCreated":"2013-06-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"A good 3D movie for the kids.","reviewBody":"Yogi Bear is about Jellystone Park about to get closed down because the town is bankrupt. Due to this, Ranger Smith (Tom Cavanagh) throws a party for Jellystone so more visitors come in, more visitors, more money. But Yogi screws it up. So now they must save the park somehow before it gets closed. Yogi (Dan Aykroyd) and Boo Boo (Justin Timberlake) do a good job at voice acting. Tom Cavanagh also does a good job, but everyone else does a bad job. ESPIALLY THE MAYOR (Andrew Daly) HE DOES NOT EVEN TRY. The 3D is pretty good, so if you have a Blu-ray 3D at home, try to rent this movie.\n\nOVERALL: It's funny, great 3D, and pretty good. Go see it, you won't be disappointed."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":21370,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.6},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2011-01-12","keywords":"park,bear,mayor,sabotage,documentary filmmaker","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Yogi Bear: Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2698381593","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk5Nzg3NDYzN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDEyODIzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk5Nzg3NDYzN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDEyODIzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A documentary filmmaker travels to Jellystone Park to shoot a project and soon crosses paths with Yogi Bear, his sidekick Boo-Boo, and Ranger Smith."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000101/","name":"Dan Aykroyd"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005493/","name":"Justin Timberlake"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0267506/","name":"Anna Faris"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0108094/","name":"Eric Brevig"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0226011/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033149/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0893262/","name":"Jennifer Ventimilia"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0827985/","name":"Joshua Sternin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0178589/","name":"Brad Copeland"}],"duration":"PT1H21M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Chicken Run
Chicken Run – Hennen rennen
programme.desc: Chicken Run: Directed by Peter Lord, Nick Park. With Phil Daniels, Lynn Ferguson, Mel Gibson, Tony Haygarth. When a cockerel apparently flies into a chicken farm, the chickens see him as an opportunity to escape their evil owners." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120630/","name":"Chicken Run","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDgxNjZlZDYtZGJmZC00Mjg0LWEwYzctYWQ0MWFjNTM3ZmM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTM5NzI0NDY@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a cockerel apparently flies into a chicken farm, the chickens see him as an opportunity to escape their evil owners.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120630/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Chrysanthepop"},"dateCreated":"2008-02-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Chicken Fun","reviewBody":"'Chicken Run' is a delighted little film about...well, chickens. I've always loved the claymation of Aardman. 'Creature Comforts' and 'Wallace and Gromit' are among many of my favorites. Aardman Studios have come up with a brilliant cast, a funny and smart script, fine cinematography and production design. The inspiration of films like 'The Great Escape' shows. The female characters are so strong and yet they have their own sense of humour and Brit-wit. Aardman's claymation is splendid. The large eyes, body size and shape and movements create this a unique class of comedy. The writing is very sharp and crisp but I disliked the obvious symbolism (of British and America joining hands to save the world and fight evil) which looked a little forced. I don't see the need to make the Rocky character an American rooster (as if it's an ingredient to have an American on board). Yet, that does not take away the sheer pleasure and entertainment one derives from the film. The voice cast is suitably chosen. Gibson plays the typical hero with charisma but it's the Brit cast, which includes names like Imelda Staunton, Lynn Ferguson, Jane Horrocks and Julia Sawalha that did it for me. Their sharp witty humour and strong will just put them on a league of their own. 'Chicken Run' is a cute, heartwarming, uplifting and hilarious little film. IMDb data; ttnr: 0120630, Title: Chicken Run, --- Description: Chicken Run: Directed by Peter Lord, Nick Park. With Phil Daniels, Lynn Ferguson, Mel Gibson, Tony Haygarth. When a cockerel apparently flies into a chicken farm, the chickens see him as an opportunity to escape their evil owners." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120630/","name":"Chicken Run","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDgxNjZlZDYtZGJmZC00Mjg0LWEwYzctYWQ0MWFjNTM3ZmM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTM5NzI0NDY@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a cockerel apparently flies into a chicken farm, the chickens see him as an opportunity to escape their evil owners.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120630/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Chrysanthepop","dateCreated":"2008-02-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Chicken Fun","reviewBody":"'Chicken Run' is a delighted little film about...well, chickens. I've always loved the claymation of Aardman. 'Creature Comforts' and 'Wallace and Gromit' are among many of my favorites. Aardman Studios have come up with a brilliant cast, a funny and smart script, fine cinematography and production design. The inspiration of films like 'The Great Escape' shows. The female characters are so strong and yet they have their own sense of humour and Brit-wit. Aardman's claymation is splendid. The large eyes, body size and shape and movements create this a unique class of comedy. The writing is very sharp and crisp but I disliked the obvious symbolism (of British and America joining hands to save the world and fight evil) which looked a little forced. I don't see the need to make the Rocky character an American rooster (as if it's an ingredient to have an American on board). Yet, that does not take away the sheer pleasure and entertainment one derives from the film. The voice cast is suitably chosen. Gibson plays the typical hero with charisma but it's the Brit cast, which includes names like Imelda Staunton, Lynn Ferguson, Jane Horrocks and Julia Sawalha that did it for me. Their sharp witty humour and strong will just put them on a league of their own. 'Chicken Run' is a cute, heartwarming, uplifting and hilarious little film. To quote another user, it is eggcellent!","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":184254,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7,"contentRating":"G","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2000-06-23","keywords":"chicken,farm,escape,rooster,freedom","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Chicken Run","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2053636121","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzk5MjZkNGItMTcwYS00MTVhLTgxNTQtOGY3Mzk1YWNiYTQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzk5MjZkNGItMTcwYS00MTVhLTgxNTQtOGY3Mzk1YWNiYTQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Universal Studios Home Entertainment","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000154/","name":"Mel Gibson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0768018/","name":"Julia Sawalha","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0200057/","name":"Phil Daniels"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0520485/","name":"Peter Lord","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0661910/","name":"Nick Park"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103531/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0129164/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022869/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0520485/","name":"Peter Lord","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0661910/","name":"Nick Park","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0456732/","name":"Karey Kirkpatrick"],"duration":"PT1H24M"</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:

A dog finds the meaning of his own existence through the lives of the humans he meets." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8385474/","name":"A Dog's Journey","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjRhMWY0ODMtMmM3OC00ZGRmLWIyZjktZGQ0ZGE4MzcyZWE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzc5MjA3OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A dog finds the meaning of his own existence through the lives of the humans he meets.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8385474/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"gwmbkm"},"dateCreated":"2019-05-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Wonderful Sequel to "A Dog's Purpose"","reviewBody":"Audiences need more movies like this one!

My husband and I went to a 4 PM weekday show as we needed to "kill" a few hours before meeting our daughter. We knew it was the same writer (W. Bruce Cameron) as two other movies we loved ("A Dog's Purpose" and "A Dog's Way Home") but we didn't know it was a sequel to "A Dog's Purpose." If you haven't seen "A Dog's Purpose" I'd strongly suggest you do so before seeing "A Dog's Journey." You'll enjoy the continuing saga of Bailey and his people much more if you do.

programme.title: Nanny McPhee and the Big Bang
Eine zauberhafte Nanny – Knall auf Fall in ein neues Abenteuer
programme.desc:
Nanny McPhee and the Big Bang: Directed by Susanna White. With Maggie Gyllenhaal, Oscar Steer, Asa Butterfield, Lil Woods. Nanny McPhee arrives to help a harried young mother who is trying to run the family farm while her husband is away at war, though she uses her magic to teach the woman's children and their two spoiled cousins five new lessons." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1415283/","name":"Nanny McPhee and the Big Bang","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI5NDUxNDU4OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDk1NjM1Mw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Nanny McPhee arrives to help a harried young mother who is trying to run the family farm while her husband is away at war, though she uses her magic to teach the woman's children and their two spoiled cousins five new lessons.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1415283/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mark-norman-01"},"dateCreated":"2010-04-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great film","reviewBody":"I don't know what the critics here were expecting, but from some of the reviews I've read it seems that it wasn't a kids' film. In short, this is a lovely, well-written, beautifully cast film that's executed with great affection and makes maximum use of its chocolate-box locations.

Emma Thompson, aside from having no little talent for scriptwriting, is savvy enough to understand that the real stars of this film are the children and, in particular, Asa Butterfield and Eros Vlahos as Norman and Cyril respectively.

Rhys Ifans shows what an accomplished comic actor he is, even if his performance as Uncle Phil seems to draw much, both in characterisation and delivery, from that of Matt Dillon's portrayal of Healy in There's Something About Mary.

There's a lovely turn from Maggie Smith as Mrs Docherty and a reassuringly exuberant performance from Sam Kelly.

If there's a lull, it's when the action moves away from its countryside setting, although the scene played between Vlahos and Ralph Feinnes works nicely.

At a little under an hour and fifty minutes, it's quite long for children, yet my five- and eight-year-olds sat transfixed throughout. And in the end, that should be the yardstick by which any film aimed at younger cinema-goers should be measured.

As to Thompson herself, she is sublime when required, understated when the surrounding action demands. The reviewer who likened her performance to that of Roger Moore does not, I would suggest, appreciate either the characterisation of the Nanny McPhee role (much can be, and is, portrayed by simple facial expressions) or the very real acting ability of our erstwhile Bond. Comedy isn't all about snappy one-liners and the ability to convey comedy simply by saying nothing is an art in and of itself.

In the final analysis, this is a better film than its predecessor. It is more lovingly-crafted, less fantastic in the literal sense and more sharply observed. Watch it for what it is - a modern take on the old Mary Poppins story - and you won't be disappointed.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":30940,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Family","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2010-06-02","keywords":"nanny,magic,farm,goat,elephant","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Nanny McPhee Returns: Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi823789337","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzUyNjIwOTEyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDQwMTU0Mw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzUyNjIwOTEyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDQwMTU0Mw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Nanny McPhee arrives to help a harried young mother who is trying to run the family farm while her husband is away at war, though she uses her magic to teach the woman's children and their two spoiled cousins five new lessons. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000668/","name":"Emma Thompson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0350454/","name":"Maggie Gyllenhaal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000146/","name":"Ralph Fiennes"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1264352/","name":"Susanna White"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000668/","name":"Emma Thompson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0104447/","name":"Christianna Brand"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

In short, this is a lovely, well-written, beautifully cast film that's executed with great affection and makes maximum use of its chocolate-box locations.

Emma Thompson, aside from having no little talent for scriptwriting, is savvy enough to understand that the real stars of this film are the children and, in particular, Asa Butterfield and Eros Vlahos as Norman and Cyril respectively.

programme.desc:
Ostwind: Directed by Katja von Garnier. With Hanna Binke, Marvin Linke, Cornelia Froboess, Tilo Prückner. A girl who thinks is not good at doing anything has to stay for the holidays with her grandmother at a riding stable. There she discovers her interest in horses, riding and more and what she is good in." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2356464/","name":"Ostwind","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWVkNjdhNzAtZmIxMC00M2MzLTk0NTMtOTQyYmVlNTViZDdiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzA3Njg4MzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A girl who thinks is not good at doing anything has to stay for the holidays with her grandmother at a riding stable. There she discovers her interest in horses, riding and more and what she is good in.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2356464/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rutzelb"},"dateCreated":"2017-01-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good Family Movie","reviewBody":"The parents of Mika (Hanna Binke) send her to her grandmother to instill some structure and discipline in her. The grandmother was once an Olympic rider and owns a riding stable. Mika feels she is not good at anything, but discovers her talent when she befriends a troubled horse named Windstorm. 

This is a good family movie about a love affair between a troubled horse and a human namely Mika. Mika discovers she has the gift of what a horse feels and they bond instantly. This is not as predictable as it may seem because there are a few bumps along the way that surprised me. (You're too easy)

This is a German movie and the English is dubbed in. After a while it is not all that distracting or noticeable as we get more involved with Mika and Windstorm. And involved you will get . The story is well told and you never want this to end. 

As far as I am concerned this is as good as the movie The Black Stallion. (8/10)

Die Vampirschwestern
programme.desc:
Die Vampirschwestern: Directed by Wolfgang Groos. With Marta Martin, Laura Antonia Roge, Christiane Paul, Stipe Erceg. A tale of two 12-year-old vampire sisters who have to adapt to the human world after their family decides to emigrate to Germany." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2186562/","name":"Die Vampirschwestern","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg3OTk1MTgzMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjQzNjAzMTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A tale of two 12-year-old vampire sisters who have to adapt to the human world after their family decides to emigrate to Germany.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2186562/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"marijkerose"},"dateCreated":"2018-08-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"I loved the movie, but IMDB desperately needs to fix the movie's description!","reviewBody":"The current (15th of August, 2018) IMDB description is absolutely wrong. The show doesn't have a character named Anastasia who's trying to save her sister from dying after drinking the blood of a dead person.

It's about two half-vampire/half-human sisters who move with their parents, a vampire father and human mother, out of Transilvania to their mother's hometown in Germany. There, they attempt to live among the humans and keep it a secret that they're vampires. The two sisters try to deal with and adjust to normal human preteen/teenage life.

I loved the movie, as said.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":731,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6},"genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2012-12-27","keywords":"vampiress,half vampire,human vampire hybrid,female human vampire hybrid,vampire girl","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5082677/","name":"Marta Martin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3016604/","name":"Laura Antonia Roge"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0666788/","name":"Christiane Paul"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0343185/","name":"Wolfgang Groos"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0244169/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0239725/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1048431/","name":"Ursula Gruber"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5084644/","name":"Franziska Gehm"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

Bailey – Ein Hund kehrt zurück
programme.desc:
A Dog's Journey: Directed by Gail Mancuso. With Josh Gad, Dennis Quaid, Kathryn Prescott, Marg Helgenberger. A dog finds the meaning of his own existence through the lives of the humans he meets." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8385474/","name":"A Dog's Journey","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjRhMWY0ODMtMmM3OC00ZGRmLWIyZjktZGQ0ZGE4MzcyZWE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzc5MjA3OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A dog finds the meaning of his own existence through the lives of the humans he meets.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8385474/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"gwmbkm"},"dateCreated":"2019-05-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Wonderful Sequel to "A Dog's Purpose"","reviewBody":"Audiences need more movies like this one!

My husband and I went to a 4 PM weekday show as we needed to "kill" a few hours before meeting our daughter. We knew it was the same writer (W. Bruce Cameron) as two other movies we loved ("A Dog's Purpose" and "A Dog's Way Home") but we didn't know it was a sequel to "A Dog's Purpose." If you haven't seen "A Dog's Purpose" I'd strongly suggest you do so before seeing "A Dog's Journey." You'll enjoy the continuing saga of Bailey and his people much more if you do.

Prepare to cry.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":22410,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-05-16","keywords":"sequel,second part,animal in title,apostrophe in title,punctuation in title","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi722450969","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDg1MTU4NWMtZGM2OC00OWUyLWI4MzktZTA2ZDQ2Yjc4MjA2XkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDg1MTU4NWMtZGM2OC00OWUyLWI4MzktZTA2ZDQ2Yjc4MjA2XkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg","description":"Bailey finds his new purpose. programme.desc:
Tooth Fairy: Directed by Michael Lembeck. With Dwayne Johnson, Ashley Judd, Stephen Merchant, Ryan Sheckler. A bad deed on the part of a tough minor-league hockey player results in an unusual sentence: He must serve one week as a real-life tooth fairy." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0808510/","name":"Tooth Fairy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ4NjQzMjQxNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTEzMDY4Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A bad deed on the part of a tough minor-league hockey player results in an unusual sentence: He must serve one week as a real-life tooth fairy.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0808510/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"anastasia4470"},"dateCreated":"2010-05-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great Family Film","reviewBody":"I don't know what the rest of these reviewers were watching but I took my 11-year-old to see this at the theater; and she used her hard-earned money to buy it on DVD as soon as it became available.

It's a feel-good story of a jaded and cynical man who realizes that it's okay to dream; it's okay to believe in things you can't see and hope for a better tomorrow. Why on earth is this a bad thing? Sure, parts of the movie rate an 11 out of 10 on the cheese-o-meter but, once again, why is this a bad thing? 

No, I don't think that this is a good date movie, or something that a bunch of adults would find entertaining, but when watching it with a group of kids, or just one 11-year-old little girl, it's a winner.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":44797,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Family","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2010-01-22","keywords":"hare krishna,man wears eyeglasses,chevrolet,chevrolet corvette,ford motor company","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Tooth Fairy: Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3394634265","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ0NjU2Mjk4Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjgzNDg4Mg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ0NjU2Mjk4Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjgzNDg4Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A bad deed on the part of a tough minor-league hockey player (Johnson) results in an unusual sentence: He must serve one week as a real-life tooth fairy."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0425005/","name":"Dwayne Johnson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000171/","name":"Ashley Judd"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000267/","name":"Julie Andrews"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0501185/","name":"Michael Lembeck"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0073388/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0093869/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0304665/","name":"Lowell Ganz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0541632/","name":"Babaloo Mandel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0827985/","name":"Joshua Sternin"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Arthur Christmas
Arthur Weihnachtsmann
programme.desc:
Arthur Christmas: Directed by Sarah Smith, Barry Cook. With James McAvoy, Hugh Laurie, Bill Nighy, Jim Broadbent. Santa's clumsy son Arthur sets out on a mission with Grandsanta to give out a present they misplaced to a young girl in less than two hours." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1430607/","name":"Arthur Christmas","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmY4Njk5OGQtZGMzYS00NmRhLTgxMzMtYzE0YzE1MDg4NDM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA4NjE0NjEy._V1_.jpg","description":"Santa's clumsy son Arthur sets out on a mission with Grandsanta to give out a present they misplaced to a young girl in less than two hours.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1430607/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Scrooge-3"},"dateCreated":"2011-11-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Delightfully charming","reviewBody":"Arthur Claus (James McAvoy) is the bumbling son of the reigning Santa, Malcolm Claus (Jim Broadbent). Arthur is relegated to the Letter Department where he can presumably do no damage. Arthur's brother Steve (Hugh Laurie) is the heir apparent to the title of Santa. Steve is handsome, confident, and in charge of the North Pole command center that monitors Santa's gift-giving flight around the world. The film opens with a bravura set piece showing how Santa is able to stop in millions of homes in one night. Hint: he has the help of thousands of elves. 

When Arthur discovers that one gift was accidentally undelivered, he becomes determined to get it to the unfortunate girl before Christmas sunrise. Even with the help of his retired grandsanta (Bill Nighy) and a perky elf (Ashley Jensen) from the Wrapping Department, can Arthur travel around the world in time?

There have been many movies over the years where Christmas must be saved from disaster, but Arthur Christmas has a very creative take on it. From the opening scene where it's established that Santa is really a dynasty through the centuries, a title handed down from father to son, to the paramilitary operation to get millions of presents delivered in one night, to the misadventures of Arthur and his grandsanta as they try to make sure one little girl is not disappointed, Arthur Christmas is fun, creative, and original. Produced by Aardman Animations in association with Sony Pictures Animation, this CGI animated film delivers Aardman's distinct brand of quirky humor and style. 

The art direction maintains the slightly skewed look of an Aardman claymation film. The character designs are asymmetric and the surface textures are realistic yet bold. The North Pole command center and Santa's high-tech sleigh are clean and modern. 

Sometimes celebrity voice talent backfires, but here it works beautifully, the English accents lending a sense of gravity that heightens the silliness. Bill Nighy is particularly good, conveying wisdom that is tinged with resentment of the modern gift-delivery methods his son and grandson use. 

Arthur Christmas is a funny, heartwarming, and poignant look at the Santa Claus mythos, adding a family dynamic that will resonate with children and adults. I expect Arthur Christmas will become a joyful holiday favorite for years to come.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":54952,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2011-11-11","keywords":"christmas,elf,christmas eve,resentment,santa claus","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2677710361","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY3ODQzNjA5MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODM5OTc4Ng@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY3ODQzNjA5MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODM5OTc4Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"On Christmas night at the North Pole, Santa's youngest son looks to use his father's high-tech operation for an urgent mission. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0564215/","name":"James McAvoy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000980/","name":"Jim Broadbent"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0631490/","name":"Bill Nighy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0809877/","name":"Sarah Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0176905/","name":"Barry Cook"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103531/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0121181/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0063165/","name":"Peter Baynham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0809877/","name":"Sarah Smith"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

From the opening scene where it's established that Santa is really a dynasty through the centuries, a title handed down from father to son, to the paramilitary operation to get millions of presents delivered in one night, to the misadventures of Arthur and his grandsanta as they try to make sure one little girl is not disappointed, Arthur Christmas is fun, creative, and original. programme.title: The Flintstones
Flintstones – Die Familie Feuerstein
programme.desc:
The Flintstones: Directed by Brian Levant. With John Goodman, Elizabeth Perkins, Rick Moranis, Rosie O'Donnell. In a parallel modern-day Stone Age world, a working-class family, the Flintstones, are set up for an executive job. But they learn that money can't buy happiness." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0109813/","name":"The Flintstones","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzY0ZTk4YzctNzYzNy00ZDQ0LTg2Y2ItZTQyYzQxMjQwMDc2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTAyODkwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In a parallel modern-day Stone Age world, a working-class family, the Flintstones, are set up for an executive job. But they learn that money can't buy happiness.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0109813/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"lukem-52760"},"dateCreated":"2019-06-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"GREAT PURE 90'S MAGICAL INNOCENT FUN.","reviewBody":"I grew up in the 90's & it was a great time & so much better than today 2019,it seemed such a fun,innocent & happier time & a great time for feelgood family films such as Casper (1995),SpaceJam (1997),Jumanji (1995),Flubber (1998),Small Soldiers (1998),ConeHeads (1993) & many many more that came out during that Awesome time. The Flintstones was a huge summertime blockbuster that's full of fun & Happy times mixed into a colourful live-action version of the classic cartoon.

I loved this movie when it came (i still do) & i remember so much merchandise & promotion for this,it was everywhere. I had action figures & fridge magnets & cups & all sorts from the movie!!! The Flintstones was huge in 1994!!! Legendary Steven Spielberg was producer so you knew the effort & budget that went into this project was huge along with the nice Spielberg feel of family & sense of wonder.

John Goodman was PERFECT as Fred Flintstone,he gave a fully fun & often touching performance & is a joy to watch. He really brought the character to life but kept the silly funny feel of fred. Legendary comic great Rick Moranis was also perfect as freds best buddy Barney Rubble & also plays his role with fun & Heart. The whole cast is great & seemed to all be having so much fun!!! Rosie O'Donnell was good fun as Betty Rubble & Elizabeth Perkins is great as Wilma Flintstone.

The music is lovely & full of Nostalgia, the production design & sets are absolutely beautiful,they created such a stunningly beautiful world for the Flintstones & it's gorgeous!!!

The Flintstones is harmless,Happy & feelgood fun for the whole family & is a great film from my childhood growing up so i hold a special little spot in my heart for this lovely little comedy.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":79032,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Family","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"1994-05-27","keywords":"based on tv series,stone age,reboot of series,based on cartoon,dinosaur","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Flintstones (1994)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1458700569","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjQ2YWIxZDktMjkxMC00YmFkLWFkYzQtNjZiMmI5ZTgwYzUzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjQ2YWIxZDktMjkxMC00YmFkLWFkYzQtNjZiMmI5ZTgwYzUzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Amblin"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000422/","name":"John Goodman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001548/","name":"Rick Moranis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005280/","name":"Rosie O'Donnell"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0505152/","name":"Brian Levant"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0024579/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0662678/","name":"Tom S. Parker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0421084/","name":"Jim Jennewein"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0211823/","name":"Steven E. de Souza"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

But they learn that money can't buy happiness." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0109813/","name":"The Flintstones","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzY0ZTk4YzctNzYzNy00ZDQ0LTg2Y2ItZTQyYzQxMjQwMDc2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTAyODkwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In a parallel modern-day Stone Age world, a working-class family, the Flintstones, are set up for an executive job. But they learn that money can't buy happiness.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0109813/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"lukem-52760","dateCreated":"2019-06-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"GREAT PURE 90'S MAGICAL INNOCENT FUN.","reviewBody":"I grew up in the 90's & it was a great time & so much better than today 2019,it seemed such a fun,innocent & happier time & a great time for feelgood family films such as Casper (1995),SpaceJam (1997),Jumanji (1995),Flubber (1998),Small Soldiers (1998),ConeHeads (1993) & many many more that came out during that Awesome time. The Flintstones was a huge summertime blockbuster that's full of fun & Happy times mixed into a colourful live-action version of the classic cartoon.

I loved this movie when it came (i still do) & i remember so much merchandise & promotion for this,it was everywhere. I had action figures & fridge magnets & cups & all sorts from the movie!!! The Flintstones was huge in 1994!!! Legendary Steven Spielberg was producer so you knew the effort & budget that went into this project was huge along with the nice Spielberg feel of family & sense of wonder.

John Goodman was PERFECT as Fred Flintstone,he gave a fully fun & often touching performance & is a joy to watch. He really brought the character to life but kept the silly funny feel of fred. Legendary comic great Rick Moranis was also perfect as freds best buddy Barney Rubble & also plays his role with fun & Heart. The whole cast is great & seemed to all be having so much fun!!! Rosie O'Donnell was good fun as Betty Rubble & Elizabeth Perkins is great as Wilma Flintstone.

The music is lovely & full of Nostalgia, the production design & sets are absolutely beautiful,they created such a stunningly beautiful world for the Flintstones & it's gorgeous!!!

The Flintstones is harmless,Happy & feelgood fun for the whole family & is a great film from my childhood growing up so i hold a special little spot in my heart for this lovely little comedy.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":79032,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Family","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"1994-05-27","keywords":"based on tv series,stone age,reboot of series,based on cartoon,dinosaur","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Flintstones (1994)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1458700569","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjQ2YWIxZDktMjkxMC00YmFkLWFkYzQtNjZiMmI5ZTgwYzUzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjQ2YWIxZDktMjkxMC00YmFkLWFkYzQtNjZiMmI5ZTgwYzUzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Amblin","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000422/","name":"John Goodman","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001548/","name":"Rick Moranis","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005280/","name":"Rosie O'Donnell"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0505152/","name":"Brian Levant"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0024579/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0662678/","name":"Tom S. programme.title: Nine Lives
Nine Lives
programme.desc: Nine Lives: Directed by Barry Sonnenfeld. With Kevin Spacey, Jennifer Garner, Robbie Amell, Cheryl Hines. A stuffy businessman finds himself trapped inside the body of his family's cat." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4383594/","name":"Nine Lives","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzEzMjkwMjc3NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzc0NjY5ODE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A stuffy businessman finds himself trapped inside the body of his family's cat.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4383594/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mnemon07"},"dateCreated":"2016-08-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"its not as bad as people say","reviewBody":"I've read some awful reviews about this movie and my expectations were set low. I was expecting to be dragged by my kids to a mix of "Baby Geniuses 2" and "Battlefield Earth". But I was pleasantly surprised. This movie won't win any Oscars, but its a reasonable kids movie. Kids liked it, and I was OK with it. Yes, the plot is predictable, and the jokes are pretty flat, but they are geared toward 10 year olds and adults who really like cats, and that is what is expected from a kids movie about a cat. If you hate cats, well, don't see it, see "Shaggy Dog" instead, its virtually the same plot, except its a different type of a pet. I think this movie is OK and I look forward to seeing new incarnations of the same plot in the future movies, such as "Being Goldie" (hint, hint movie studio, in about 10 years we will be ready for another one of those plots)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":22082,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Family"],"datePublished":"2016-08-03","keywords":"cat,skyscraper,husband wife relationship,body swap,business","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1764930585","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc2MzQ2MjI0M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTg0NjY5ODE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc2MzQ2MjI0M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTg0NjY5ODE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Stuffy businessman Tom Brand (Kevin Spacey) finds himself trapped inside the body of his family's cat. If any hope exists of returning to his family as the husband and father they deserve, Tom will have to learn why he has been placed in this peculiar situation and the great lengths he must go to earn back his human existence."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000228/","name":"Kevin Spacey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004950/","name":"Jennifer Garner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2064412/","name":"Robbie Amell"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001756/","name":"Barry Sonnenfeld"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048273/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0269133/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0031670/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0527095/","name":"Gwyn Lurie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0020820/","name":"Matt Allen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0933128/","name":"Caleb Wilson"}],"duration":"PT1H27M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Sahara
Sahara – Abenteuer in der Wüste
programme.desc: Sahara: Directed by Breck Eisner. With Jude Akuwudike, Mark Aspinall, Rakie Ayola, Christopher Bello. Master explorer Dirk Pitt goes on the adventure of a lifetime of seeking out a lost Civil War battleship known as the "Ship of Death" in the deserts of West Africa while helping a WHO doctor being hounded by a ruthless dictator." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0318649/","name":"Sahara","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjExOTM4NDUzNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTgzNzczMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Master explorer Dirk Pitt goes on the adventure of a lifetime of seeking out a lost Civil War battleship known as the "Ship of Death" in the deserts of West Africa while helping a WHO doctor being hounded by a ruthless dictator.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0318649/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"buiger"},"dateCreated":"2007-12-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pure escapism... but what's wrong with that?","reviewBody":"This movie is definitely not a masterpiece. The screenplay is dumb. The acting is to say the least, average. The story is preposterous. Yet, as Ebert nicely put it, "I enjoyed this movie on its own dumb level, which must mean (I am forced to conclude) in my own dumb way". Yes, this is a film you should watch with your brain switched comfortably to the 'Off' position, a nice cold beer on the table and a bag of popcorn in your lap. When you come to think about it though, isn't that what movies are supposed to be all about in the first place?\n\nP.S. One thing worth mention though is the excellent cinematography. The movie is a wonderful African picture book, which definitely helps the overall experience.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":95772,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2005-04-20","keywords":"beach,evil man,good versus evil,bare chested male,disguise","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Sahara","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2089091353","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDdlYjVlYjAtZTc2Ny00NzJjLWFlYjUtM2YyZjY3MjYyNGIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDdlYjVlYjAtZTc2Ny00NzJjLWFlYjUtM2YyZjY3MjYyNGIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Paramount Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000190/","name":"Matthew McConaughey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004851/","name":"Penélope Cruz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001872/","name":"Steve Zahn"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0252135/","name":"Breck Eisner"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0129170/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0145519/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0193774/","name":"Clive Cussler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0232776/","name":"Thomas Dean Donnelly"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0649191/","name":"Joshua Oppenheimer"}],"duration":"PT2H4M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: About Schmidt
About Schmidt
programme.desc:
About Schmidt: Directed by Alexander Payne. With Jack Nicholson, Kathy Bates, Hope Davis, Dermot Mulroney. A recently retired man embarks on a journey to his estranged daughter's wedding, only to discover more about himself and life than he ever expected." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0257360/","name":"About Schmidt","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDgxYzgyMGUtYTkxYS00Yzk5LWIwMmItNGIzY2I5ZTE3MmNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjk1Njg5NTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A recently retired man embarks on a journey to his estranged daughter's wedding, only to discover more about himself and life than he ever expected.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0257360/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"diane-34"},"dateCreated":"2004-09-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Life's quirks","reviewBody":"I love Nicolson and I thought his work in this film was as good as any I have seen him do in any of his previous films. My accolades must begin with the writers for creating such a beautiful novel and script-a perfect canvas for the many fine actors in this film upon which they wove their considerable magic. There were no killings, no car chases, no violence of any kind-I'm surprised that Hollywood distributed it.

Such a slice of life-American life with it's many warts-warts that the Americans probably don't even recognize: Winnebagos like moving palaces, freeway monuments to genocide, business that consumes it's workers only to dump them unceremoniously, too much of everything that amounts to emptiness, etc., etc. The novel by Begley, upon which the film was based, illustrated this consumer emptiness brilliantly by the inclusion of the bookends to the film, the sponsorship of the Tanzanian child by Schmidt. The child's material emptiness was contrasted with Schmidt's emotional emptiness in a way America does not recognize much less watch on the screen.

The last part of the movie dealing with the marriage of Schmidt's daughter to a man who came from a diametrically opposite "new age" family was an unstated acknowledgment by his daughter that she wanted nothing of her father's values-she wanted a complete break and she was going to marry the break.

A fascinating, complex movie and I'm sorry I didn't see it much earlier."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":126790,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2003-04-09","keywords":"minden nebraska,retirement party,recreational vehicle,omaha nebraska,female nudity","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"About Schmidt","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3820224793","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzIyMmQyMjUtOWI4Ny00NzZiLWI2NzgtZDQ0YmEzOTk1NTRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzIyMmQyMjUtOWI4Ny00NzZiLWI2NzgtZDQ0YmEzOTk1NTRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from New Line Cinema"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000197/","name":"Jack Nicholson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0204706/","name":"Hope Davis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000551/","name":"Dermot Mulroney"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668247/","name":"Alexander Payne"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028247/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1095201/","name":"Louis Begley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668247/","name":"Alexander Payne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0852591/","name":"Jim Taylor"}],"duration":"PT2H5M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0257360, Title: About Schmidt, --- Description: About Schmidt: Directed by Alexander Payne. With Jack Nicholson, Kathy Bates, Hope Davis, Dermot Mulroney. A recently retired man embarks on a journey to his estranged daughter's wedding, only to discover more about himself and life than he ever expected." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0257360/","name":"About Schmidt","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDgxYzgyMGUtYTkxYS00Yzk5LWIwMmItNGIzY2I5ZTE3MmNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjk1Njg5NTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A recently retired man embarks on a journey to his estranged daughter's wedding, only to discover more about himself and life than he ever expected.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0257360/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"diane-34","dateCreated":"2004-09-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Life's quirks","reviewBody":"I love Nicolson and I thought his work in this film was as good as any I have seen him do in any of his previous films. My accolades must begin with the writers for creating such a beautiful novel and script-a perfect canvas for the many fine actors in this film upon which they wove their considerable magic. There were no killings, no car chases, no violence of any kind-I'm surprised that Hollywood distributed it.

Such a slice of life-American life with it's many warts-warts that the Americans probably don't even recognize: Winnebagos like moving palaces, freeway monuments to genocide, business that consumes it's workers only to dump them unceremoniously, too much of everything that amounts to emptiness, etc., etc. The novel by Begley, upon which the film was based, illustrated this consumer emptiness brilliantly by the inclusion of the bookends to the film, the sponsorship of the Tanzanian child by Schmidt. The child's material emptiness was contrasted with Schmidt's emotional emptiness in a way America does not recognize much less watch on the screen.

The last part of the movie dealing with the marriage of Schmidt's daughter to a man who came from a diametrically opposite "new age" family was an unstated acknowledgment by his daughter that she wanted nothing of her father's values-she wanted a complete break and she was going to marry the break.

A fascinating, complex movie and I'm sorry I didn't see it much earlier.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":126790,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2003-04-09","keywords":"minden nebraska,retirement party,recreational vehicle,omaha nebraska,female nudity","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"About Schmidt","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3820224793","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzIyMmQyMjUtOWI4Ny00NzZiLWI2NzgtZDQ0YmEzOTk1NTRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzIyMmQyMjUtOWI4Ny00NzZiLWI2NzgtZDQ0YmEzOTk1NTRjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from New Line Cinema","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000197/","name":"Jack Nicholson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0204706/","name":"Hope Davis","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000551/","name":"Dermot Mulroney"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668247/","name":"Alexander Payne"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028247/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1095201/","name":"Louis Begley","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0668247/","name":"Alexander Payne","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0852591/","name":"Jim Taylor"],"duration":"PT2H5M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Bucket List
Das Beste kommt zum Schluss
programme.desc:
The Bucket List: Directed by Rob Reiner. With Jack Nicholson, Morgan Freeman, Sean Hayes, Beverly Todd. Two terminally ill men escape from a cancer ward and head off on a road trip with a wish list of to-dos before they die." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0825232/","name":"The Bucket List","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY2NTUyMjIyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNzYwMDM4._V1_.jpg","description":"Two terminally ill men escape from a cancer ward and head off on a road trip with a wish list of to-dos before they die.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0825232/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jewbearjosh"},"dateCreated":"2008-01-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"heart warming story of friendship-strong male performances","reviewBody":"On new years day, 2008, I saw the film "The Bucket List." It was not my first choice of a film that I wanted to see. To be honest, however, I probably would not have enjoyed any of the films that I would have chosen more. This film is very well done. I liked the screenplay, by Justin Zackham. I liked the direction, by the real talented Rob Reiner. And I was very impressed by the acting. Jack Nicholson and Morgan Freeman did a superb job, playing two dying old guys who befriend each other, and together have the adventure of their lives. The film is very good. The plot involves this hospital owner-Edward Cole-who is dying from cancer, and another cancer victim-Carter Chambers-who meets Cole while getting treatment at the same hospital. After they both find out that they each have only a few months to live, they agree to travel together all over the globe, and follow this list of tasks. They call it the bucket list.

Nicholson gives a real touching performance as Ed Cole. He plays Cole funny, sad, stubborn, angry, strong, fearless, and loud. Morgan gives an equally touching performance as C. Chambers. He plays Chambers smart, cool, romantic, funny, fearless, and emotional. Both men are very moving in this film. They are great sharing the screen. I really enjoyed watching them play scenes together. It was for me a real treat. These guys, Nicholson and Freeman, are two of our finest actors. And this film is no exception.

Even though "The Bucket List" is a small film about friendship, and the meaning of truly living, I do not recommend it for the preteens. There are some very adult scenes. However, families with teenagers will enjoy seeing it together.

Josh Weinman","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":238805,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2008-04-02","keywords":"falling asleep,usa,united states,list,journey","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Bucket List","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3367043353","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwNDA5MTE2OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDQxNzYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwNDA5MTE2OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDQxNzYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Bucket List - Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000197/","name":"Jack Nicholson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000151/","name":"Morgan Freeman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005003/","name":"Sean Hayes"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001661/","name":"Rob Reiner"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0287540/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0188112/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0951698/","name":"Justin Zackham"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

Newlywed couple Ted and Tami-Lynn want to have a baby, but in order to qualify to be a parent, Ted will have to prove he's a person in a court of law." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2637276/","name":"Ted 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEwMDg3MDk1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjYyODA1NTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Newlywed couple Ted and Tami-Lynn want to have a baby, but in order to qualify to be a parent, Ted will have to prove he's a person in a court of law.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2637276/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"MR_Heraclius"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Ted","reviewBody":"If you're a fan of the first Ted movie you'll probably enjoy the second as well but I think everybody can pretty much agree the first one was a lot funnier. The performances are still decent with some laughs, the biggest problem is is the ho-hum story that isn't engaging. The freshness from the first movie is gone as well. All in all Ted 2 is a slightly fun little comedy if you enjoyed the first one just don't expect it to be as good.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":196660,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2015-06-26","keywords":"lawyer,fight,scene after end credits,trial,talking teddy bear","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"In Theaters June 26","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2232528921","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIzNjM5NjE2N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTU3MTc5NTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIzNjM5NjE2N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTU3MTc5NTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"In Ted 2, newlywed couple Ted and Tami-Lynn want to have a baby, but in order to qualify to be a parent, Ted will have to prove he's a person in a court of law."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000242/","name":"Mark Wahlberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0532235/","name":"Seth MacFarlane"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1086543/","name":"Amanda Seyfried"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0532235/","name":"Seth MacFarlane"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0194736/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065872/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0532235/","name":"Seth MacFarlane"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1273148/","name":"Alec Sulkin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1273397/","name":"Wellesley Wild"}],"duration":"PT1H55M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Fun with Dick and Jane
Dick und Jane – Zu allem bereit, zu nichts zu gebrauchen
programme.desc: Fun with Dick and Jane: Directed by Dean Parisot. With Jim Carrey, Téa Leoni, Alec Baldwin, Richard Jenkins. When an affluent couple lose all their money following a series of blunders, they turn to a life of crime to make ends meet." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0369441/","name":"Fun with Dick and Jane","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTJiMWFiNzgtMDQxZi00NTFiLWE2YjMtNTA5NzY5YzQxZjNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"When an affluent couple lose all their money following a series of blunders, they turn to a life of crime to make ends meet.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0369441/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Smells_Like_Cheese"},"dateCreated":"2006-01-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"I had fun with Dick and Jane","reviewBody":"Well, was this the best Jim Carrey comedy? Not really, but it is one of his better late one's. I think because I have had the week from heck, I just needed a good laugh, thanks to Jim. :) Anywho, Dick and Jane are two average Americans who follow by the rules and manage a reasonable budget. When the company that Dick owns goes broke, he is fired, he and Jane are now in trouble when Dick cannot find a job fast enough. Piece by piece they are loosing or having to sell their stuff, when Dick receives an eviction notice, he and Jane have had it and will no longer play by the rules to live their lives once again. With a cast who seemed to enjoy making the film, I think this was over all a funny movie to watch and would recommend it.\n\n7/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":141335,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2006-02-08","keywords":"head shop,character names in title,forenames in title,ceo,suburb","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Fun with Dick and Jane","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3769106713","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDE1ZDUwODktZmJkZS00Y2Y5LWJkZTItOWE5MGEwMDVmMTdiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDE1ZDUwODktZmJkZS00Y2Y5LWJkZTItOWE5MGEwMDVmMTdiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000120/","name":"Jim Carrey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000495/","name":"Téa Leoni"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000285/","name":"Alec Baldwin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0661751/","name":"Dean Parisot"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003687/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0169347/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0031976/","name":"Judd Apatow"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0831557/","name":"Nicholas Stoller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0301416/","name":"Gerald Gaiser"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

Not really, but it is one of his better late one's. I think because I have had the week from heck, I just needed a good laugh, thanks to Jim. :) Anywho, Dick and Jane are two average Americans who follow by the rules and manage a reasonable budget. When the company that Dick owns goes broke, he is fired, he and Jane are now in trouble when Dick cannot find a job fast enough. Piece by piece they are loosing or having to sell their stuff, when Dick receives an eviction notice, he and Jane have had it and will no longer play by the rules to live their lives once again. programme.desc:
Bean: Directed by Mel Smith. With Rowan Atkinson, Peter MacNicol, John Mills, Pamela Reed. The bumbling Mr. Bean travels to America when he is given the responsibility of bringing a highly valuable painting to a Los Angeles museum." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0118689/","name":"Bean","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjU2YzY5NDEtM2M3NC00NGM0LTg3MmItNWQ1OWY2ZmNkZTU0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"The bumbling Mr. Bean travels to America when he is given the responsibility of bringing a highly valuable painting to a Los Angeles museum.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0118689/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"DVD_Connoisseur"},"dateCreated":"2006-12-31","inLanguage":"English","name":"Average but warm-hearted comedy","reviewBody":""Bean" is the average but warm-hearted, large screen adventure of Rowan Atkinson's bumbling but strangely likable character.

With a smörgåsbord of talent behind this film, there are a few genuine laughs but, sadly, they're few and far between. This film could have been so much better in the hands of another director. Mel Smith appears to have been on cruise-control making this movie. It's a case of comedy by numbers and the film never seems to shift gear.

The always amusing Peter MacNicol is excellent as the suffering David Langley and provides the perfect foil to Atkinson's Bean.

An average comedy movie, it's worth a viewing if there's nothing else on the television."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":101639,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"1997-08-01","keywords":"mr bean character,california,los angeles california,1990s,surname as title","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bean","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1186529561","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzllZjYzNGEtZTM3YS00YTBmLTgyM2UtODZhMzQ0OWZhMjMwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzllZjYzNGEtZTM3YS00YTBmLTgyM2UtODZhMzQ0OWZhMjMwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Gramercy Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000100/","name":"Rowan Atkinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001493/","name":"Peter MacNicol"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0590055/","name":"John Mills"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0809321/","name":"Mel Smith"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030612/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057311/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103644/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000100/","name":"Rowan Atkinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0193485/","name":"Richard Curtis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003741/","name":"Robin Driscoll"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="
