programme.title: It Could Happen to You
Zwei Millionen Dollar Trinkgeld
programme.desc:
It Could Happen to You: Directed by Andrew Bergman. With Nicolas Cage, Bridget Fonda, Rosie Perez, Wendell Pierce. A police officer promises to share his lottery ticket with a waitress in lieu of a tip." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0110167/","name":"It Could Happen to You","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzMxOGUzOWEtMGUxMi00ZWM1LWE3ODgtNzc4OGVjZmJhMmFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODY0NzcxNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A police officer promises to share his lottery ticket with a waitress in lieu of a tip.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0110167/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"floydianer"},"dateCreated":"2006-02-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"This is how a modern romantic comedy should look like","reviewBody":"If you judge "It Could Happen to you" by its amount of realistic situations and characters, you'll probably give it a 4 out of 10. But, who cares about realism here? It's like a modern fairy tale, Frank Capra transported into the 90s. There's a wonderful storyline (Cop gives waitress a 2 million dollar tip), which apparently is even based on real-life events. Nicolas Cage plays the most honest cop imaginable, and he proves he can play a romantic lead role just as well as a dramatic action/thriller one. His character is not exactly 100 percent realistic, but that's not a problem, this is Hollywood for heaven's sake.

Even better than Cage is his female leading lady: the fascinating Bridget Fonda. Fonda is a wonderful actress who can play both a cute character like her waitress Yvonne here and more challenging roles like the LadyMacBeth-similar one in "A Simple Plan". Unfortunately she never had the career of a Julia Roberts but she is in fact more talented and better looking. Throughout the whole movie she gives a good performance and looks gorgeous. If I had the choice of giving a waitress the lottery money or not and the woman looked like Fonda I might even give it to her. Of course there aren't so many waitresses out there that look (and behave) as charming as her and chances are low I'll ever win two millions in the lottery.

Also notable is the wonderful chemistry between Cage and Fonda. As for the supporting roles special mention has to go to Perez. Although you wonder why Cage married her in the first place, she gives a humorous and entertaining performance. Of course there's kitsch but that's not necessarily bad. Good kitsch can be wonderful and this film, that has an absolutely great happy ending, serves as a perfect example of how a romantic comedy should be filmed. It's better than "Pretty Woman".","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":38148,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1994-07-29","keywords":"hot air balloon,generosity,lottery,waitress,winning the lottery","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"It Could Happen to You","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1269760281","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg2MmJjM2ItMTM5Ny00NTBlLTk3ZTQtNzFiOWRhZWNlNDAwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg2MmJjM2ItMTM5Ny00NTBlLTk3ZTQtNzFiOWRhZWNlNDAwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000115/","name":"Nicolas Cage"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000403/","name":"Bridget Fonda"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001609/","name":"Rosie Perez"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000921/","name":"Andrew Bergman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005883/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0026862/","name":"Jane Anderson"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Friends with Benefits
Freunde mit gewissen Vorzügen
programme.desc:
Friends with Benefits: Directed by Will Gluck. With Justin Timberlake, Mila Kunis, Patricia Clarkson, Jenna Elfman. A young man and woman decide to take their friendship to the next level without becoming a couple, but soon discover that adding sex only leads to complications." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1632708/","name":"Friends with Benefits","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2MzQ0NTk4N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDc2NDYzNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young man and woman decide to take their friendship to the next level without becoming a couple, but soon discover that adding sex only leads to complications.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1632708/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"DICK STEEL"},"dateCreated":"2011-10-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Nutshell Review: Friends with Benefits","reviewBody":"2011 will probably go down as the year Hollywood tells us having F* buddies is OK and encouraged, with no less than three films this year set around the premise of pure sex without strings or emotions attached, with Love and Other Drugs and No Strings Attached setting the precedence earlier with an incredibly good looking cast in all sorts of undress - Anne Hathaway, Jake Gyllenhaal, Natalie Portman and Ashton Kutcher - and added to the list will be current IT guy and girl Justin Timberlake and Mila Kunis rolling beneath the sheets in a typical love story between the emotionally unavailable and the emotionally damaged.

Mila Kunis stars as Jamie, a headhunter in New York who persuades her target Dylan played by Justin Timberlake to ditch his young, upstart blogging team to join GQ (how's that for a little bit of subtle advertising) in revamping its website and to infuse new content ideas. A night out prior to the offer seals the LA based Dylan to relocate and take up the offer, with plenty of activities thrown in that if it's not Jamie being his only friend in a new, big city, they would serve as activities that would fit in for an awesome date night out. Before long they become firm friends, and made a pact to keep things physical since they each have their wants, and with the other party game to get down and dirty, so begins their game of tennis (though personally I prefer analogy with, and the term "bedminton" - it involves cocks after all). After all, why complicate what would be a beautiful friendship, if sex can be treated just as sex without the emotions thrown in to mess things up?

You know the clichéd drill by now, with things moving along fine and dandy, the hint of emotions coming into play to really turn things upside down, the narrative montage to show how frequent they mate like jackrabbits, before some large, needy episode or statements uttered that will probably reveal the true state of affairs, and the list goes on. Deny all you want, but one cannot help but to agree that the fairer sex will have things rough if pacts of this nature turn sour, and expectedly in a movie they always do, otherwise everyone will be happy without adversary, frustration and challenges to overcome and provide that change in strength of character.

And it is this power of the cliché that absolutely calls the shots in films like these. You know what will happen, but want to see them happen anyway even though you're multiple steps ahead of every character. And it is precisely these expectations that anyone would want to see covered, and try as the filmmakers want it is the clichés that they find hard to break away from, even if characters here proclaim very early on that romance in their world shouldn't be like an unbelievable Hollywood film, but in what would be art imitating art, look who's talking to begin with. And what's with the fixation about consistently taking the shine off the captain of US Airways Flight 1549 in its emergency landing onto the Hudson River?

Justin Timberlake is fast becoming the busy bona fide movie star since The Social Network, and continues his run with this film and In Time which will hit the screens here soon. He has that boyish charm that the camera just loves, and being a real life singer meant covering a number of songs here, from Stereophonics to Kris Kross made it look all too easy. Mila Kunis plays her role as the emotionally damaged girl with aplomb, and shares an effective chemistry with Timberlake that makes this film a delight to sit through, even if as mentioned the story's cliché and we know just about how these two nice looking people will likely get together. 

The supporting characters while one dimensional almost always threaten to steal the show, from Patricia Clarkson as Jamie's sex crazed mom extending the lifespan of a running joke involving the nationality of Jamie's unseen dad, Woody Harrelson as the gay colleague of Dylan who always have innuendos offhand to share, Jenna Elfman who plays Dylan's sister and Richard Jenkins starring as Dylan's dad who's suffering from advancing Alzheimer's disease, which is especially poignant as it deals with the subplot of how a family copes with a loved one who's behaviour develops erratically, and holding the key to a pivotal personal experience to share and turn things around.

With Andy Samberg and Emma Stone making cameos (the latter being extremely crazy as a fanatical John Meyer fan), Friends With Benefits has its main leads to thank for in milking quite the cliché story for the masses, who are likely to make a beeline just to see those two in some down and dirty action, not that you get to see a lot to begin with anyway. Recommended, and stay tuned until after the end credits roll for more commentary when the two are sitting at a couch watching the outtakes of a DVD movie."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":353653,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2011-07-22","keywords":"female rear nudity,blow job,no panties,oral sex,scantily clad female","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2190056729","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYwMzE4OTc0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzM3NzY3NA@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYwMzE4OTc0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzM3NzY3NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The relationship between two friends (Justin Timberlake and Mila Kunis) gets complicated when they decide to get romantic. IMDb data; ttnr: 1632708, Title: Friends with Benefits, --- Description: Friends with Benefits: Directed by Will Gluck. With Justin Timberlake, Mila Kunis, Patricia Clarkson, Jenna Elfman. A young man and woman decide to take their friendship to the next level without becoming a couple, but soon discover that adding sex only leads to complications." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1632708/","name":"Friends with Benefits","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2MzQ0NTk4N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDc2NDYzNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young man and woman decide to take their friendship to the next level without becoming a couple, but soon discover that adding sex only leads to complications.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1632708/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"DICK STEEL","dateCreated":"2011-10-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Nutshell Review: Friends with Benefits","reviewBody":"2011 will probably go down as the year Hollywood tells us having F* buddies is OK and encouraged, with no less than three films this year set around the premise of pure sex without strings or emotions attached, with Love and Other Drugs and No Strings Attached setting the precedence earlier with an incredibly good looking cast in all sorts of undress - Anne Hathaway, Jake Gyllenhaal, Natalie Portman and Ashton Kutcher - and added to the list will be current IT guy and girl Justin Timberlake and Mila Kunis rolling beneath the sheets in a typical love story between the emotionally unavailable and the emotionally damaged.

Mila Kunis stars as Jamie, a headhunter in New York who persuades her target Dylan played by Justin Timberlake to ditch his young, upstart blogging team to join GQ (how's that for a little bit of subtle advertising) in revamping its website and to infuse new content ideas. A night out prior to the offer seals the LA based Dylan to relocate and take up the offer, with plenty of activities thrown in that if it's not Jamie being his only friend in a new, big city, they would serve as activities that would fit in for an awesome date night out. Before long they become firm friends, and made a pact to keep things physical since they each have their wants, and with the other party game to get down and dirty, so begins their game of tennis (though personally I prefer analogy with, and the term "bedminton" - it involves cocks after all). After all, why complicate what would be a beautiful friendship, if sex can be treated just as sex without the emotions thrown in to mess things up?

You know the clichéd drill by now, with things moving along fine and dandy, the hint of emotions coming into play to really turn things upside down, the narrative montage to show how frequent they mate like jackrabbits, before some large, needy episode or statements uttered that will probably reveal the true state of affairs, and the list goes on. Deny all you want, but one cannot help but to agree that the fairer sex will have things rough if pacts of this nature turn sour, and expectedly in a movie they always do, otherwise everyone will be happy without adversary, frustration and challenges to overcome and provide that change in strength of character.

And it is this power of the cliché that absolutely calls the shots in films like these. You know what will happen, but want to see them happen anyway even though you're multiple steps ahead of every character. And it is precisely these expectations that anyone would want to see covered, and try as the filmmakers want it is the clichés that they find hard to break away from, even if characters here proclaim very early on that romance in their world shouldn't be like an unbelievable Hollywood film, but in what would be art imitating art, look who's talking to begin with. And what's with the fixation about consistently taking the shine off the captain of US Airways Flight 1549 in its emergency landing onto the Hudson River?

Justin Timberlake is fast becoming the busy bona fide movie star since The Social Network, and continues his run with this film and In Time which will hit the screens here soon. He has that boyish charm that the camera just loves, and being a real life singer meant covering a number of songs here, from Stereophonics to Kris Kross made it look all too easy. Mila Kunis plays her role as the emotionally damaged girl with aplomb, and shares an effective chemistry with Timberlake that makes this film a delight to sit through, even if as mentioned the story's cliché and we know just about how these two nice looking people will likely get together. 

The supporting characters while one dimensional almost always threaten to steal the show, from Patricia Clarkson as Jamie's sex crazed mom extending the lifespan of a running joke involving the nationality of Jamie's unseen dad, Woody Harrelson as the gay colleague of Dylan who always have innuendos offhand to share, Jenna Elfman who plays Dylan's sister and Richard Jenkins starring as Dylan's dad who's suffering from advancing Alzheimer's disease, which is especially poignant as it deals with the subplot of how a family copes with a loved one who's behaviour develops erratically, and holding the key to a pivotal personal experience to share and turn things around.

With Andy Samberg and Emma Stone making cameos (the latter being extremely crazy as a fanatical John Meyer fan), Friends With Benefits has its main leads to thank for in milking quite the cliché story for the masses, who are likely to make a beeline just to see those two in some down and dirty action, not that you get to see a lot to begin with anyway. Recommended, and stay tuned until after the end credits roll for more commentary when the two are sitting at a couch watching the outtakes of a DVD movie.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":353653,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2011-07-22","keywords":"female rear nudity,blow job,no panties,oral sex,scantily clad female","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2190056729","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYwMzE4OTc0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzM3NzY3NA@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYwMzE4OTc0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzM3NzY3NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The relationship between two friends (Justin Timberlake and Mila Kunis) gets complicated when they decide to get romantic. programme.desc: It's Complicated: Directed by Nancy Meyers. With Meryl Streep, Steve Martin, Alec Baldwin, John Krasinski. When attending their son's college graduation, a couple reignite the spark in their relationship. But the complicated fact is they're divorced and he's remarried." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1230414/","name":"It's Complicated","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjQ0NjM2NTI4N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjQ2MDc5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When attending their son's college graduation, a couple reignite the spark in their relationship. But the complicated fact is they're divorced and he's remarried.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1230414/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"barrys82"},"dateCreated":"2010-02-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Watch it just for its cast","reviewBody":"The name of the movie is It's Complicated but the film is everything but complicated, in fact this is the simplest and lightest movie I've seen in a very long time. It's Complicated follows the story of Jane (Streep) that during her son's graduation hooks up with her ex-husband Jake (Baldwin)and at the same time she is dating Adam, her architect. The movie has some good moments of humor but the situations tends to repeat over and over making the movie a little boring. The story is kinda predictable and the plot is a bit lame and corny but the movie is worthy because of its cast. Actors like Alec Baldwin and Steve Maritn and an actress like Meryl Streep make it a real joy. Their performances are excellent and so funny. In conclusion, It's complicated is a movie mostly intended for people over 30's and 40's. programme.title: Fun with Dick and Jane
Dick und Jane – Zu allem bereit, zu nichts zu gebrauchen
programme.desc: Fun with Dick and Jane: Directed by Dean Parisot. With Jim Carrey, Téa Leoni, Alec Baldwin, Richard Jenkins. When an affluent couple lose all their money following a series of blunders, they turn to a life of crime to make ends meet." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0369441/","name":"Fun with Dick and Jane","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTJiMWFiNzgtMDQxZi00NTFiLWE2YjMtNTA5NzY5YzQxZjNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"When an affluent couple lose all their money following a series of blunders, they turn to a life of crime to make ends meet.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0369441/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Smells_Like_Cheese"},"dateCreated":"2006-01-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"I had fun with Dick and Jane","reviewBody":"Well, was this the best Jim Carrey comedy? Not really, but it is one of his better late one's. I think because I have had the week from heck, I just needed a good laugh, thanks to Jim. :) Anywho, Dick and Jane are two average Americans who follow by the rules and manage a reasonable budget. When the company that Dick owns goes broke, he is fired, he and Jane are now in trouble when Dick cannot find a job fast enough. Piece by piece they are loosing or having to sell their stuff, when Dick receives an eviction notice, he and Jane have had it and will no longer play by the rules to live their lives once again. With a cast who seemed to enjoy making the film, I think this was over all a funny movie to watch and would recommend it.\n\n7/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":141335,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2006-02-08","keywords":"head shop,character names in title,forenames in title,ceo,suburb","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Fun with Dick and Jane","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3769106713","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDE1ZDUwODktZmJkZS00Y2Y5LWJkZTItOWE5MGEwMDVmMTdiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDE1ZDUwODktZmJkZS00Y2Y5LWJkZTItOWE5MGEwMDVmMTdiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000120/","name":"Jim Carrey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000495/","name":"Téa Leoni"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000285/","name":"Alec Baldwin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0661751/","name":"Dean Parisot"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003687/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0169347/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0031976/","name":"Judd Apatow"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0831557/","name":"Nicholas Stoller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0301416/","name":"Gerald Gaiser"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

Scrambling up their last money, two dudes journey to Mallorca to fullfill their dream and participate in Europe's most famous beach parties." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0118678/","name":"Ballermann 6","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEzMTUyMDA0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzI4NjcxMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Scrambling up their last money, two dudes journey to Mallorca to fullfill their dream and participate in Europe's most famous beach parties.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0118678/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bscrooked"},"dateCreated":"2021-09-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"I love it","reviewBody":"I first saw this movie when I was like 15, 16 years old, partying on Mallorca/ at the Ballermann was an absolute highlight. I absolutely love the humor in this one, it's so stupid, I'm still dying over it every single time - and watched the movie uncountable times. Both main characters are absolutely hilarious. Over the top, but you can easily like them. I didn't like their two other movies "voll normaaal" and especially "die superbullen" very well, but they definitely nailed it with Ballermann 6. If you can get into the snese of humor, you've at least got to like it. The performances are still decent with some laughs, the biggest problem is is the ho-hum story that isn't engaging. The freshness from the first movie is gone as well. All in all Ted 2 is a slightly fun little comedy if you enjoyed the first one just don't expect it to be as good.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":196660,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2015-06-26","keywords":"lawyer,fight,scene after end credits,trial,talking teddy bear","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"In Theaters June 26","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2232528921","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIzNjM5NjE2N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTU3MTc5NTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIzNjM5NjE2N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTU3MTc5NTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"In Ted 2, newlywed couple Ted and Tami-Lynn want to have a baby, but in order to qualify to be a parent, Ted will have to prove he's a person in a court of law."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000242/","name":"Mark Wahlberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0532235/","name":"Seth MacFarlane"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1086543/","name":"Amanda Seyfried"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0532235/","name":"Seth MacFarlane"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0194736/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065872/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0532235/","name":"Seth MacFarlane"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1273148/","name":"Alec Sulkin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1273397/","name":"Wellesley Wild"}],"duration":"PT1H55M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding
My Big Fat Greek Wedding – Hochzeit auf griechisch
programme.desc:
My Big Fat Greek Wedding: Directed by Joel Zwick. With Nia Vardalos, Michael Constantine, Christina Eleusiniotis, Kaylee Vieira. A young Greek woman falls in love with a non-Greek and struggles to get her family to accept him while she comes to terms with her heritage and cultural identity." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0259446/","name":"My Big Fat Greek Wedding","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzcwOWU4NGEtYjUyMy00MDNlLThiN2MtYzFlMjk4Y2FhNjlmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjk1Njg5NTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young Greek woman falls in love with a non-Greek and struggles to get her family to accept him while she comes to terms with her heritage and cultural identity.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0259446/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"gringostarz"},"dateCreated":"2004-03-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"A charming although formulaic romantic comedy","reviewBody":"My Big Fat Greek Wedding makes up for what it lacks in plot with a cast of amusing, lovable characters. Like any large extended family the Portokolos family is a collection of oddball, zany characters. Toula's father Gus can find the Greek root of any word, and believes windex to be a wondrous cure to any ailment. Toula's mother says "the man may be the head of the household, but the woman is the neck, she can turn the head whichever way she wants". And throughout the movie we see matriarchal power in action as she and Aunt Voula subtly manipulate Gus, the father. Toula's Cousin Nikki with her provocative fashion sense and brother Nick with his quiet passion for art, fill out the Portokolos personality tree.

In contrast the Millers are a subdued, small family. Ian has only two cousins. When Toula invites the Millers over for a quiet dinner to meet her parents they are in for quite a shock. The dynamics between the overwhelmingly extroverted Portokolos family and the reserved parents of the groom provide some amusing moments.

My Big Fat Greek Wedding had potential to be an exceptional film. It was hindered by a far too contrived romance and a particularly unconvincing performance by John Corbett as Ian Miller. His character was so lacking in personality, so bland, especially in contrast to the Portokolos family members. Plus the robotic delivery of his declarations of love were unbelievable. His character seemed an afterthought. Had Ian Miller been better acted, and developed as well as all of the supporting characters, the film would have been great. However, it is still an above average romantic comedy, providing many laughs and feel good moments.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":125827,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2002-12-25","keywords":"greek restaurant,culture clash,greek,wedding,cross cultural relationship","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"My Big Fat Greek Wedding","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3014459673","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGE2NTgwN2YtMzJlMi00ZTc4LWI5MDEtMGRmMTA2NTQwODcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGE2NTgwN2YtMzJlMi00ZTc4LWI5MDEtMGRmMTA2NTQwODcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0889522/","name":"Nia Vardalos"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0179173/","name":"John Corbett"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0176073/","name":"Michael Constantine"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0959034/","name":"Joel Zwick"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0076476/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008693/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009247/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0889522/","name":"Nia Vardalos"}],"duration":"PT1H35M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0259446, Title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding, --- Description: My Big Fat Greek Wedding: Directed by Joel Zwick. With Nia Vardalos, Michael Constantine, Christina Eleusiniotis, Kaylee Vieira. A young Greek woman falls in love with a non-Greek and struggles to get her family to accept him while she comes to terms with her heritage and cultural identity." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0259446/","name":"My Big Fat Greek Wedding","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzcwOWU4NGEtYjUyMy00MDNlLThiN2MtYzFlMjk4Y2FhNjlmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjk1Njg5NTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young Greek woman falls in love with a non-Greek and struggles to get her family to accept him while she comes to terms with her heritage and cultural identity.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0259446/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"gringostarz","dateCreated":"2004-03-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"A charming although formulaic romantic comedy","reviewBody":"My Big Fat Greek Wedding makes up for what it lacks in plot with a cast of amusing, lovable characters. Like any large extended family the Portokolos family is a collection of oddball, zany characters. Toula's father Gus can find the Greek root of any word, and believes windex to be a wondrous cure to any ailment. Toula's mother says "the man may be the head of the household, but the woman is the neck, she can turn the head whichever way she wants". And throughout the movie we see matriarchal power in action as she and Aunt Voula subtly manipulate Gus, the father. Toula's Cousin Nikki with her provocative fashion sense and brother Nick with his quiet passion for art, fill out the Portokolos personality tree.

In contrast the Millers are a subdued, small family. Ian has only two cousins. When Toula invites the Millers over for a quiet dinner to meet her parents they are in for quite a shock. The dynamics between the overwhelmingly extroverted Portokolos family and the reserved parents of the groom provide some amusing moments.

My Big Fat Greek Wedding had potential to be an exceptional film. It was hindered by a far too contrived romance and a particularly unconvincing performance by John Corbett as Ian Miller. His character was so lacking in personality, so bland, especially in contrast to the Portokolos family members. Plus the robotic delivery of his declarations of love were unbelievable. His character seemed an afterthought. Had Ian Miller been better acted, and developed as well as all of the supporting characters, the film would have been great. However, it is still an above average romantic comedy, providing many laughs and feel good moments.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":125827,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2002-12-25","keywords":"greek restaurant,culture clash,greek,wedding,cross cultural relationship","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"My Big Fat Greek Wedding","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3014459673","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGE2NTgwN2YtMzJlMi00ZTc4LWI5MDEtMGRmMTA2NTQwODcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGE2NTgwN2YtMzJlMi00ZTc4LWI5MDEtMGRmMTA2NTQwODcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0889522/","name":"Nia Vardalos","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0179173/","name":"John Corbett","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0176073/","name":"Michael Constantine"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0959034/","name":"Joel Zwick"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0076476/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008693/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009247/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0889522/","name":"Nia Vardalos"],"duration":"PT1H35M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: It Could Happen to You
Zwei Millionen Dollar Trinkgeld
programme.desc:
It Could Happen to You: Directed by Andrew Bergman. With Nicolas Cage, Bridget Fonda, Rosie Perez, Wendell Pierce. A police officer promises to share his lottery ticket with a waitress in lieu of a tip." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0110167/","name":"It Could Happen to You","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzMxOGUzOWEtMGUxMi00ZWM1LWE3ODgtNzc4OGVjZmJhMmFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODY0NzcxNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A police officer promises to share his lottery ticket with a waitress in lieu of a tip.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0110167/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"floydianer"},"dateCreated":"2006-02-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"This is how a modern romantic comedy should look like","reviewBody":"If you judge "It Could Happen to you" by its amount of realistic situations and characters, you'll probably give it a 4 out of 10. But, who cares about realism here? It's like a modern fairy tale, Frank Capra transported into the 90s. There's a wonderful storyline (Cop gives waitress a 2 million dollar tip), which apparently is even based on real-life events. Nicolas Cage plays the most honest cop imaginable, and he proves he can play a romantic lead role just as well as a dramatic action/thriller one. His character is not exactly 100 percent realistic, but that's not a problem, this is Hollywood for heaven's sake.

Even better than Cage is his female leading lady: the fascinating Bridget Fonda. Fonda is a wonderful actress who can play both a cute character like her waitress Yvonne here and more challenging roles like the LadyMacBeth-similar one in "A Simple Plan". Unfortunately she never had the career of a Julia Roberts but she is in fact more talented and better looking. Throughout the whole movie she gives a good performance and looks gorgeous. If I had the choice of giving a waitress the lottery money or not and the woman looked like Fonda I might even give it to her. Of course there aren't so many waitresses out there that look (and behave) as charming as her and chances are low I'll ever win two millions in the lottery.

Also notable is the wonderful chemistry between Cage and Fonda. As for the supporting roles special mention has to go to Perez. Although you wonder why Cage married her in the first place, she gives a humorous and entertaining performance. Of course there's kitsch but that's not necessarily bad. Good kitsch can be wonderful and this film, that has an absolutely great happy ending, serves as a perfect example of how a romantic comedy should be filmed. It's better than "Pretty Woman".","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":38148,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1994-07-29","keywords":"hot air balloon,generosity,lottery,waitress,winning the lottery","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"It Could Happen to You","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1269760281","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg2MmJjM2ItMTM5Ny00NTBlLTk3ZTQtNzFiOWRhZWNlNDAwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTg2MmJjM2ItMTM5Ny00NTBlLTk3ZTQtNzFiOWRhZWNlNDAwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000115/","name":"Nicolas Cage"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000403/","name":"Bridget Fonda"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001609/","name":"Rosie Perez"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000921/","name":"Andrew Bergman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005883/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0026862/","name":"Jane Anderson"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: It's Complicated
Wenn Liebe so einfach wäre
programme.desc: It's Complicated: Directed by Nancy Meyers. With Meryl Streep, Steve Martin, Alec Baldwin, John Krasinski. When attending their son's college graduation, a couple reignite the spark in their relationship. But the complicated fact is they're divorced and he's remarried." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1230414/","name":"It's Complicated","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjQ0NjM2NTI4N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjQ2MDc5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When attending their son's college graduation, a couple reignite the spark in their relationship. But the complicated fact is they're divorced and he's remarried.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1230414/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"barrys82"},"dateCreated":"2010-02-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Watch it just for its cast","reviewBody":"The name of the movie is It's Complicated but the film is everything but complicated, in fact this is the simplest and lightest movie I've seen in a very long time. It's Complicated follows the story of Jane (Streep) that during her son's graduation hooks up with her ex-husband Jake (Baldwin)and at the same time she is dating Adam, her architect. The movie has some good moments of humor but the situations tends to repeat over and over making the movie a little boring. The story is kinda predictable and the plot is a bit lame and corny but the movie is worthy because of its cast. Actors like Alec Baldwin and Steve Maritn and an actress like Meryl Streep make it a real joy. Their performances are excellent and so funny. In conclusion, It's complicated is a movie mostly intended for people over 30's and 40's. Women will love it and men will enjoy it also","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":89907,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2010-02-03","keywords":"mature romance,female protagonist,lovers,ex husband ex wife rekindling their relationship,divorced couple","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"It's Complicated -- International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1404699929","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIxNTc0NjU3MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzc0MTM5Mg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIxNTc0NjU3MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzc0MTM5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A romantic comedy in which a divorced man (Baldwin) vies for the affection of his ex-wife (Streep), who is being courted by an architect (Martin)."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000658/","name":"Meryl Streep"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000188/","name":"Steve Martin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000285/","name":"Alec Baldwin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0583600/","name":"Nancy Meyers"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0114441/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0583600/","name":"Nancy Meyers"}],"duration":"PT2H1M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Friends with Benefits
Freunde mit gewissen Vorzügen
programme.desc:
Friends with Benefits: Directed by Will Gluck. With Justin Timberlake, Mila Kunis, Patricia Clarkson, Jenna Elfman. A young man and woman decide to take their friendship to the next level without becoming a couple, but soon discover that adding sex only leads to complications." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1632708/","name":"Friends with Benefits","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2MzQ0NTk4N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDc2NDYzNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young man and woman decide to take their friendship to the next level without becoming a couple, but soon discover that adding sex only leads to complications.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1632708/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"DICK STEEL"},"dateCreated":"2011-10-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Nutshell Review: Friends with Benefits","reviewBody":"2011 will probably go down as the year Hollywood tells us having F* buddies is OK and encouraged, with no less than three films this year set around the premise of pure sex without strings or emotions attached, with Love and Other Drugs and No Strings Attached setting the precedence earlier with an incredibly good looking cast in all sorts of undress - Anne Hathaway, Jake Gyllenhaal, Natalie Portman and Ashton Kutcher - and added to the list will be current IT guy and girl Justin Timberlake and Mila Kunis rolling beneath the sheets in a typical love story between the emotionally unavailable and the emotionally damaged.

Mila Kunis stars as Jamie, a headhunter in New York who persuades her target Dylan played by Justin Timberlake to ditch his young, upstart blogging team to join GQ (how's that for a little bit of subtle advertising) in revamping its website and to infuse new content ideas. A night out prior to the offer seals the LA based Dylan to relocate and take up the offer, with plenty of activities thrown in that if it's not Jamie being his only friend in a new, big city, they would serve as activities that would fit in for an awesome date night out. Before long they become firm friends, and made a pact to keep things physical since they each have their wants, and with the other party game to get down and dirty, so begins their game of tennis (though personally I prefer analogy with, and the term "bedminton" - it involves cocks after all). After all, why complicate what would be a beautiful friendship, if sex can be treated just as sex without the emotions thrown in to mess things up?

You know the clichéd drill by now, with things moving along fine and dandy, the hint of emotions coming into play to really turn things upside down, the narrative montage to show how frequent they mate like jackrabbits, before some large, needy episode or statements uttered that will probably reveal the true state of affairs, and the list goes on. Deny all you want, but one cannot help but to agree that the fairer sex will have things rough if pacts of this nature turn sour, and expectedly in a movie they always do, otherwise everyone will be happy without adversary, frustration and challenges to overcome and provide that change in strength of character.

And it is this power of the cliché that absolutely calls the shots in films like these. You know what will happen, but want to see them happen anyway even though you're multiple steps ahead of every character. And it is precisely these expectations that anyone would want to see covered, and try as the filmmakers want it is the clichés that they find hard to break away from, even if characters here proclaim very early on that romance in their world shouldn't be like an unbelievable Hollywood film, but in what would be art imitating art, look who's talking to begin with. And what's with the fixation about consistently taking the shine off the captain of US Airways Flight 1549 in its emergency landing onto the Hudson River?

Justin Timberlake is fast becoming the busy bona fide movie star since The Social Network, and continues his run with this film and In Time which will hit the screens here soon. He has that boyish charm that the camera just loves, and being a real life singer meant covering a number of songs here, from Stereophonics to Kris Kross made it look all too easy. Mila Kunis plays her role as the emotionally damaged girl with aplomb, and shares an effective chemistry with Timberlake that makes this film a delight to sit through, even if as mentioned the story's cliché and we know just about how these two nice looking people will likely get together. 

The supporting characters while one dimensional almost always threaten to steal the show, from Patricia Clarkson as Jamie's sex crazed mom extending the lifespan of a running joke involving the nationality of Jamie's unseen dad, Woody Harrelson as the gay colleague of Dylan who always have innuendos offhand to share, Jenna Elfman who plays Dylan's sister and Richard Jenkins starring as Dylan's dad who's suffering from advancing Alzheimer's disease, which is especially poignant as it deals with the subplot of how a family copes with a loved one who's behaviour develops erratically, and holding the key to a pivotal personal experience to share and turn things around.

With Andy Samberg and Emma Stone making cameos (the latter being extremely crazy as a fanatical John Meyer fan), Friends With Benefits has its main leads to thank for in milking quite the cliché story for the masses, who are likely to make a beeline just to see those two in some down and dirty action, not that you get to see a lot to begin with anyway. Recommended, and stay tuned until after the end credits roll for more commentary when the two are sitting at a couch watching the outtakes of a DVD movie."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":353653,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2011-07-22","keywords":"female rear nudity,blow job,no panties,oral sex,scantily clad female","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2190056729","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYwMzE4OTc0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzM3NzY3NA@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYwMzE4OTc0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzM3NzY3NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The relationship between two friends (Justin Timberlake and Mila Kunis) gets complicated when they decide to get romantic. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005109/","name":"Mila Kunis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005493/","name":"Justin Timberlake"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0165101/","name":"Patricia Clarkson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0323239/","name":"Will Gluck"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010568/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040620/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0110404/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2226647/","name":"Keith Merryman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2226970/","name":"David A. Newman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0323239/","name":"Will Gluck"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 1632708, Title: Friends with Benefits, --- Description: Friends with Benefits: Directed by Will Gluck. With Justin Timberlake, Mila Kunis, Patricia Clarkson, Jenna Elfman. A young man and woman decide to take their friendship to the next level without becoming a couple, but soon discover that adding sex only leads to complications." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1632708/","name":"Friends with Benefits","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ2MzQ0NTk4N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDc2NDYzNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young man and woman decide to take their friendship to the next level without becoming a couple, but soon discover that adding sex only leads to complications.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1632708/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"DICK STEEL","dateCreated":"2011-10-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Nutshell Review: Friends with Benefits","reviewBody":"2011 will probably go down as the year Hollywood tells us having F* buddies is OK and encouraged, with no less than three films this year set around the premise of pure sex without strings or emotions attached, with Love and Other Drugs and No Strings Attached setting the precedence earlier with an incredibly good looking cast in all sorts of undress - Anne Hathaway, Jake Gyllenhaal, Natalie Portman and Ashton Kutcher - and added to the list will be current IT guy and girl Justin Timberlake and Mila Kunis rolling beneath the sheets in a typical love story between the emotionally unavailable and the emotionally damaged.

Mila Kunis stars as Jamie, a headhunter in New York who persuades her target Dylan played by Justin Timberlake to ditch his young, upstart blogging team to join GQ (how's that for a little bit of subtle advertising) in revamping its website and to infuse new content ideas. A night out prior to the offer seals the LA based Dylan to relocate and take up the offer, with plenty of activities thrown in that if it's not Jamie being his only friend in a new, big city, they would serve as activities that would fit in for an awesome date night out. Before long they become firm friends, and made a pact to keep things physical since they each have their wants, and with the other party game to get down and dirty, so begins their game of tennis (though personally I prefer analogy with, and the term "bedminton" - it involves cocks after all). After all, why complicate what would be a beautiful friendship, if sex can be treated just as sex without the emotions thrown in to mess things up?

You know the clichéd drill by now, with things moving along fine and dandy, the hint of emotions coming into play to really turn things upside down, the narrative montage to show how frequent they mate like jackrabbits, before some large, needy episode or statements uttered that will probably reveal the true state of affairs, and the list goes on. Deny all you want, but one cannot help but to agree that the fairer sex will have things rough if pacts of this nature turn sour, and expectedly in a movie they always do, otherwise everyone will be happy without adversary, frustration and challenges to overcome and provide that change in strength of character.

And it is this power of the cliché that absolutely calls the shots in films like these. You know what will happen, but want to see them happen anyway even though you're multiple steps ahead of every character. And it is precisely these expectations that anyone would want to see covered, and try as the filmmakers want it is the clichés that they find hard to break away from, even if characters here proclaim very early on that romance in their world shouldn't be like an unbelievable Hollywood film, but in what would be art imitating art, look who's talking to begin with. And what's with the fixation about consistently taking the shine off the captain of US Airways Flight 1549 in its emergency landing onto the Hudson River?

Justin Timberlake is fast becoming the busy bona fide movie star since The Social Network, and continues his run with this film and In Time which will hit the screens here soon. He has that boyish charm that the camera just loves, and being a real life singer meant covering a number of songs here, from Stereophonics to Kris Kross made it look all too easy. Mila Kunis plays her role as the emotionally damaged girl with aplomb, and shares an effective chemistry with Timberlake that makes this film a delight to sit through, even if as mentioned the story's cliché and we know just about how these two nice looking people will likely get together. 

The supporting characters while one dimensional almost always threaten to steal the show, from Patricia Clarkson as Jamie's sex crazed mom extending the lifespan of a running joke involving the nationality of Jamie's unseen dad, Woody Harrelson as the gay colleague of Dylan who always have innuendos offhand to share, Jenna Elfman who plays Dylan's sister and Richard Jenkins starring as Dylan's dad who's suffering from advancing Alzheimer's disease, which is especially poignant as it deals with the subplot of how a family copes with a loved one who's behaviour develops erratically, and holding the key to a pivotal personal experience to share and turn things around.

With Andy Samberg and Emma Stone making cameos (the latter being extremely crazy as a fanatical John Meyer fan), Friends With Benefits has its main leads to thank for in milking quite the cliché story for the masses, who are likely to make a beeline just to see those two in some down and dirty action, not that you get to see a lot to begin with anyway. Recommended, and stay tuned until after the end credits roll for more commentary when the two are sitting at a couch watching the outtakes of a DVD movie.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":353653,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2011-07-22","keywords":"female rear nudity,blow job,no panties,oral sex,scantily clad female","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2190056729","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYwMzE4OTc0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzM3NzY3NA@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYwMzE4OTc0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzM3NzY3NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The relationship between two friends (Justin Timberlake and Mila Kunis) gets complicated when they decide to get romantic. programme.title: Miss Congeniality
Miss Undercover
programme.desc: Miss Congeniality: Directed by Donald Petrie. With Sandra Bullock, Michael Caine, Benjamin Bratt, Candice Bergen. An F.B.I. Agent must go undercover in the Miss United States beauty pageant to prevent a group from bombing the event." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0212346/","name":"Miss Congeniality","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDhjNzc4N2MtNWE5ZC00N2M4LWFiYjEtMTE5YmYyMTg3OGY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkzODUwNzk@._V1_.jpg","description":"An F.B.I. Agent must go undercover in the Miss United States beauty pageant to prevent a group from bombing the event.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0212346/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Special-K88"},"dateCreated":"2002-03-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"silly material made worthwhile","reviewBody":"Good-natured and funny comedy has Bullock perfectly cast as an uptight, tomboyish federal agent who—for the first time in her entire life—decides to embrace her femininity after she's assigned to go undercover at a beauty pageant to try and apprehend an elusive criminal. She's never even worn a dress, much less makeup and accessories, and the results are hilarious as she tries to do her job and be a credible contestant as well. Film's setup and execution are predictable, yet kept afloat by a meaningful story, good lines, and big time laughs. Bullock is as appealing as she's ever been, and surrounded here by a first-rate supporting cast. ***"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":198450,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2001-04-11","keywords":"beauty contest,fbi federal bureau of investigation,knee high boots,boots,pageant","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Miss Congeniality","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1980671001","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjAwNDcxYjQtOTNmMy00YzA3LWFhNmQtMGZkYjY5N2Y0Y2MyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjAwNDcxYjQtOTNmMy00YzA3LWFhNmQtMGZkYjY5N2Y0Y2MyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Miss Congeniality"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000113/","name":"Sandra Bullock"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000323/","name":"Michael Caine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000973/","name":"Benjamin Bratt"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0677953/","name":"Donald Petrie"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040620/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108864/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0024939/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0492909/","name":"Marc Lawrence"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0974301/","name":"Katie Ford"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0524095/","name":"Caryn Lucas"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Miss Congeniality 2: Armed & Fabulous
Miss Undercover 2
programme.desc:
Miss Congeniality 2: Armed & Fabulous: Directed by John Pasquin. With Sandra Bullock, Regina King, Enrique Murciano, William Shatner. After Heather Burns (Cheryl Frasier) and Stan Fields (William Shatner) are kidnapped, Gracie Hart (Sandra Bullock) goes undercover in Las Vegas, Nevada to find them." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0385307/","name":"Miss Congeniality 2: Armed & Fabulous","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAxNzk2OTI2OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODk0MDIzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"After Heather Burns (Cheryl Frasier) and Stan Fields (William Shatner) are kidnapped, Gracie Hart (Sandra Bullock) goes undercover in Las Vegas, Nevada to find them.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0385307/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mls-11"},"dateCreated":"2005-03-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Rare Sequel That Does Justice To The Original","reviewBody":"Having looked forward for a long time to see this film finally released, my wife and I were not disappointed. Not only did Gracie pick up from the last story and run, there was a great enhancement with the addition of Regina King as "Sam" in the story. Gracie and Sam were incredibly different, but remarkably alike.

Of course, bringing back the majority of the original supporting roles & characters was excellent - as well as the tie-in to Eric with the tearful telephone break-up.

Do not hesitate to see this film, for you will be pleased with some great lines and equally-great physical humor. I believe that Sandra Bullock is developing a physical humor persona in the style of Lucille Ball.

Great job, Sandra. Now, if only you can get your personal life in some sense of order?!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":72451,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2005-04-06","keywords":"knee high boots,boots,undercover,tied to a chair,bound and gagged","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Miss Congeniality 2: Armed and Fabulous","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4036362521","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWQzY2MyMGEtZDI4OS00MTU2LTg5OGQtZWY4NjBhNGQxZmE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWQzY2MyMGEtZDI4OS00MTU2LTg5OGQtZWY4NjBhNGQxZmE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000113/","name":"Sandra Bullock"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005093/","name":"Regina King"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000638/","name":"William Shatner"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0664756/","name":"John Pasquin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040620/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0108864/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0015475/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0492909/","name":"Marc Lawrence"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0974301/","name":"Katie Ford"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0524095/","name":"Caryn Lucas"}],"duration":"PT1H55M"}</script><metacontent="

Im Bett mit Holly
programme.desc: Holly Slept Over: Directed by Joshua Friedlander. With Josh Lawson, Nathalie Emmanuel, Britt Lower, Erinn Hayes. This unconventional comedy follows the relationship struggles of a married couple trying to conceive, their friends who have lost their spark, and the tension that ensues when an old college roommate stays over for the weekend." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7453044/","name":"Holly Slept Over","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWYxMjA3MTQtNmNhNS00ZjEwLTkyM2MtOWNmNDMxYTMxMWZjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyOTU3MjU4ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"This unconventional comedy follows the relationship struggles of a married couple trying to conceive, their friends who have lost their spark, and the tension that ensues when an old college roommate stays over for the weekend.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7453044/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"redblue-63741"},"dateCreated":"2020-03-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Funny, touching, and felt very real at the same time","reviewBody":"It might be because I'm the perfect age group for this, but this movie was so honest that it felt good. Sexuality and relationships are inherently messy things, and this movie does everything justice while keeping things funny. I think the target audience for a movie like this might be rather small though, it doesn't really fall into any traditional categories or genres. programme.title: Bumblebee
Bumblebee
programme.desc:
Bumblebee: Directed by Travis Knight. With Hailee Steinfeld, Jorge Lendeborg Jr., John Cena, Jason Drucker. On the run in the year 1987, Bumblebee finds refuge in a junkyard in a small California beach town. On the cusp of turning 18 and trying to find her place in the world, Charlie Watson discovers Bumblebee, battle-scarred and broken." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4701182/","name":"Bumblebee","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjUwNjU5NDMyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzgxNjM2NzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"On the run in the year 1987, Bumblebee finds refuge in a junkyard in a small California beach town. On the cusp of turning 18 and trying to find her place in the world, Charlie Watson discovers Bumblebee, battle-scarred and broken.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4701182/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kevinxirau"},"dateCreated":"2018-12-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Finally the Transformers movie we deserve.","reviewBody":"In 2007, Michael Bay showed the world that today's technology could bring the famed Transformers to life on the big screen. Sadly, he has the finesse of a brick to the face as his subsequent films for the most part are rusted pieces of scrap due to his crude style of filmmaking, lack of focus, and narrow demographic, leaving fans with only the 80s animated movie as the true "good one", that is until now.

Plot: Charlie Watson (Hailee Steinfeld), a teen girl struggling to move on after her father's untimely death, encounters the fugitive Autobot Bumblebee and the two form a heartfelt bond, which will be tested as they are hunted by both the secretive Sector 7 and a couple of Decepticons.

Knight knows what makes a film truly stick with people and that is in the story and how one tells it, something he excels at. He gives his films heart, thus the relationship between Charlie and Bumblebee feels natural. The central focus is this friendship with many scenes that are charming, funny, and hit hard in the feels. Unlike the stuttering and super uptight Sam Witwicky, Charlie has a lot of spunk and pathos. While having a predictable character arc, John Cena did a nice job with his role. I love that this film is not only set in the 80s (when the show came out), but lives and breathes pop cultural references and classic songs from that era (including a great callback to Stan Bush). While Bay's action focuses on huge zany explosion-fests that push believability and heavily involve the human military, here the action is smaller and much more personal, strictly Autobot vs Decepticon as it should be since it was what the franchise was built on. In fact, the portrayal of the Decepticons has improved; not only can I tell them apart this time thanks to their varied designs and color schemes, but they're given more personality and actually live up to their name.

The only thing that has me puzzled is the continuity as there's confusion over whether or not this is a reboot or a prequel given some conflicting elements. That being said, this is, in many ways, the Transformers movie I've been itching to see for a long time. I'd like to see more directors present their takes on the franchise and go to places both familiar and new as long as Bay stays out of the directing chair. To sum it up, Bumblebee's got the Touch.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":152675,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2018-12-21","keywords":"prequel,transformer robot,bumblebee the autobot,birthday,spin off","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"In Theaters Thursday","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1473100313","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjJlNmI5MDQtMmU4ZS00ZTcwLTkwMjUtNzY2NmY0ZWUzMjMwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjJlNmI5MDQtMmU4ZS00ZTcwLTkwMjUtNzY2NmY0ZWUzMjMwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2794962/","name":"Hailee Steinfeld"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7449863/","name":"Jorge Lendeborg Jr."},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1078479/","name":"John Cena"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1325899/","name":"Travis Knight"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0130376/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0562497/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0117723/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5429637/","name":"Christina Hodson"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 4701182, Title: Bumblebee, --- Description: Bumblebee: Directed by Travis Knight. With Hailee Steinfeld, Jorge Lendeborg Jr., John Cena, Jason Drucker. On the run in the year 1987, Bumblebee finds refuge in a junkyard in a small California beach town. On the cusp of turning 18 and trying to find her place in the world, Charlie Watson discovers Bumblebee, battle-scarred and broken." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4701182/","name":"Bumblebee","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjUwNjU5NDMyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzgxNjM2NzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"On the run in the year 1987, Bumblebee finds refuge in a junkyard in a small California beach town. On the cusp of turning 18 and trying to find her place in the world, Charlie Watson discovers Bumblebee, battle-scarred and broken.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4701182/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"kevinxirau","dateCreated":"2018-12-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Finally the Transformers movie we deserve.","reviewBody":"In 2007, Michael Bay showed the world that today's technology could bring the famed Transformers to life on the big screen. Sadly, he has the finesse of a brick to the face as his subsequent films for the most part are rusted pieces of scrap due to his crude style of filmmaking, lack of focus, and narrow demographic, leaving fans with only the 80s animated movie as the true "good one", that is until now.

Plot: Charlie Watson (Hailee Steinfeld), a teen girl struggling to move on after her father's untimely death, encounters the fugitive Autobot Bumblebee and the two form a heartfelt bond, which will be tested as they are hunted by both the secretive Sector 7 and a couple of Decepticons.

Knight knows what makes a film truly stick with people and that is in the story and how one tells it, something he excels at. He gives his films heart, thus the relationship between Charlie and Bumblebee feels natural. The central focus is this friendship with many scenes that are charming, funny, and hit hard in the feels. Unlike the stuttering and super uptight Sam Witwicky, Charlie has a lot of spunk and pathos. While having a predictable character arc, John Cena did a nice job with his role. I love that this film is not only set in the 80s (when the show came out), but lives and breathes pop cultural references and classic songs from that era (including a great callback to Stan Bush). While Bay's action focuses on huge zany explosion-fests that push believability and heavily involve the human military, here the action is smaller and much more personal, strictly Autobot vs Decepticon as it should be since it was what the franchise was built on. In fact, the portrayal of the Decepticons has improved; not only can I tell them apart this time thanks to their varied designs and color schemes, but they're given more personality and actually live up to their name.

The only thing that has me puzzled is the continuity as there's confusion over whether or not this is a reboot or a prequel given some conflicting elements. That being said, this is, in many ways, the Transformers movie I've been itching to see for a long time. I'd like to see more directors present their takes on the franchise and go to places both familiar and new as long as Bay stays out of the directing chair. To sum it up, Bumblebee's got the Touch.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":152675,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2018-12-21","keywords":"prequel,transformer robot,bumblebee the autobot,birthday,spin off","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"In Theaters Thursday","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1473100313","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjJlNmI5MDQtMmU4ZS00ZTcwLTkwMjUtNzY2NmY0ZWUzMjMwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjJlNmI5MDQtMmU4ZS00ZTcwLTkwMjUtNzY2NmY0ZWUzMjMwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2794962/","name":"Hailee Steinfeld","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7449863/","name":"Jorge Lendeborg Jr.","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1078479/","name":"John Cena"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1325899/","name":"Travis Knight"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0130376/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0562497/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0117723/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5429637/","name":"Christina Hodson"],"duration":"PT1H54M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Transformers: Dark of the Moon
Transformers 3 – Die dunkle Seite des Mondes
programme.desc:
Transformers: Dark of the Moon: Directed by Michael Bay. With Shia LaBeouf, Rosie Huntington-Whiteley, Josh Duhamel, John Turturro. The Autobots learn of a Cybertronian spacecraft hidden on the moon, and race against the Decepticons to reach it and to learn its secrets." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1399103/","name":"Transformers: Dark of the Moon","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkwOTY0MTc1NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDQwNjA2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Autobots learn of a Cybertronian spacecraft hidden on the moon, and race against the Decepticons to reach it and to learn its secrets.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1399103/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"gavin-thelordofthefu-48-460297"},"dateCreated":"2013-11-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"A bit of an improvement over ROTF, but not nearly as good as the first","reviewBody":"In order to coincide with a fourth Transformers coming out in the next few months, I'll be reviewing this third entry of the successful film series. I liked the first Transformers despite it's cheesy dialog in some parts and while there were some awkward moments and very bad dialog, I still liked Revenge of the Fallen. Then, when I saw the whole thing in theaters back at 2011, I thought, this wasn't so bad after all. It later turned out to be a good ride, but while I do think it's a bit of an improvement over the previous film, it's nowhere near as good as the first.

First, there are some good things that saved the film for me. The music score from Steve Jablonsky has improved and has an epic tone to it. The story is a lot more decent than the previous film with a much better second and third halves; the action sequences are solid especially the collapsing building scene which took my very breath away. The scenery is great and the special effects are as top-notch as ever. The acting is good, too. While John Turturo, Franches McDormand, and John Malkovich aren't given much to do, they did fine with the material. Patrick Dempsey did OK as the villain, but he's a bit underwhelming. Rosie Hunter Whiteley is a bit bland, but not exactly terrible as the new girlfriend for Sam Witwicky. While Shia LeBeouf isn't as charismatic as he was in the first film, he does have the same charm he brought to the film series so far. The Autobots and Decepticons are great to see again and the voice actors are solid especially Leonard Nimoy as Sentinal Prime, who is a very good villain for the movie much Megatron.

Then, there are the bad things that I would point out. First, the script. While the second and third halves are a lot better, the first half is pretty boring. It seems to be lacking in it's action and it wasn't exciting. Second, the ending is way too similar to the first Transformers (what? with the auto-bots and decepticons fight against each other while bringing destruction to the city and such?) The pacing is also very sluggish it would almost put you to sleep. Third and mostly the final problem is the dialog. There are some humorous bits that might get the audience a chuckle, but there are other parts that are just so inane it would give you a headache.

Overall, Transformers: DOTM isn't nearly as good as the first, but despite the flaws that I just stated, I think this is a great sequel in an overall solid franchise. I may not be a fan of Michael Bay and such, but while I do not like the Bad Boys films, Pearl Harbor, and others, I think that this and the other films are a lot better and it deserves a recommendation to those who haven't seen it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":395947,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2011-06-29","keywords":"job interview,year 1969,optimus prime character,robert f. kennedy character,megatron character","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #3","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi543989017","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYyOTgwOTExOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDQ0NzcyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYyOTgwOTExOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDQ0NzcyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Autobots learn of a Cybertronian spacecraft hidden on the Moon, and race against the Decepticons to reach it and learn its secrets, which could turn the tide in the Transformers' final battle."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0479471/","name":"Shia LaBeouf"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2492819/","name":"Rosie Huntington-Whiteley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0879085/","name":"Tyrese Gibson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000881/","name":"Michael Bay"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040938/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0130376/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0472567/","name":"Ehren Kruger"}],"duration":"PT2H34M"}</script><metacontent="
